query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 O insensata cura de’ mortali, 2 quanto son difettivi silogismi 3 quei che ti fanno in basso batter l’ali!
4 Chi dietro a iura e chi ad amforismi 5 sen giva, e chi seguendo sacerdozio, 6 e chi regnar per forza o per sofismi,
7 e chi rubare e chi civil negozio, 8 chi nel diletto de la carne involto 9 s’affaticava e chi si dava a l’ozio,
10 quando, da tutte queste cose sciolto, 11 con Bëatrice m’era suso in cielo 12 cotanto glorïosamente accolto.
query.result:
**English:**
1 O senseless eagerness of mortals, 2 how defective are the syllogisms 3 that make you beat your wings downward!
4 One goes after laws, another after medical aphorisms, 5 another follows the priesthood, 6 another seeks to rule by force or by trickery,
7 another to steal, another to engage in public affairs, 8 another toils in the pleasures of the flesh, 9 and another gives himself up to idleness,
10 when, freed from all these things, 11 with Beatrice I was welcomed up into heaven 12 with such glorious honor.
**Sanskrit:**
1 He mūḍhā mānuseṣu vyāpṛtiḥ, 2 katham viparītāḥ tarkāḥ, 3 ye tvām adhastāt patatramānayanti!
4 Kaścid niyamān, kaścid vaidyakīyāni sūtrāṇi, 5 kaścid yājakabhāvam, 6 kaścid balātkāreṇa vā chalair vā rājyam,
7 kaścid steyam, kaścid lokakāryam, 8 kaścid māṃsavigrahāṇe ramate, 9 kaścid ālasye līyate,
10 yadā, etebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ vimuktaḥ, 11 Bēatrice-sahitaḥ svarge mām āropayām āsa, 12 tathā mahatā sammāneneva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Poi che ciascuno fu tornato ne lo 14 punto del cerchio in che avanti s’era, 15 fermossi, come a candellier candelo.
query.result:
**English:**
13 After each one had returned to the 14 point of the circle where he had been before, 15 they stood still, like candles in a candlestick.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Tataḥ paścāt yaḥ yaḥ puruṣaḥ pratyāgataḥ āsīt 14 tasya tasya pūrvasthitasya vṛttasya madhye sthāne, 15 sthitaḥ abhavat, yathā pradīpa-sthāne pradīpaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 E io senti’ dentro a quella lumera 17 che pria m’avea parlato, sorridendo 18 incominciar, faccendosi più mera:
19 «Così com’ io del suo raggio resplendo, 20 sì, riguardando ne la luce etterna, 21 li tuoi pensieri onde cagioni apprendo.
query.result:
**English:**
16 And I heard within that light 17 which had spoken to me before, smiling 18 begin, becoming brighter:
19 "Just as I shine with its radiance, 20 so, looking into the eternal light, 21 I learn the causes of your thoughts.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Aham ca śṛṇomi antas tasya prakāśasya 17 yaḥ pūrvaṃ mayā saha abhāṣata, hasan 18 ārabhate, adhikaṃ prakāśamānaḥ:
19 "Yathā aham tasya raśmeḥ prakāśe, 20 evam, nitye prakāśe avalokayan, 21 tava cintāḥ yataḥ kāraṇāṇi jānāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Tu dubbi, e hai voler che si ricerna 23 in sì aperta e ’n sì distesa lingua 24 lo dicer mio, ch’al tuo sentir si sterna,
25 ove dinanzi dissi: “U’ ben s’impingua”, 26 e là u’ dissi: “Non nacque il secondo”; 27 e qui è uopo che ben si distingua.
query.result:
**English:**
22 You are in doubt, and you want my speech to be explained 23 in such clear and ample language 24 that it may conform to your understanding,
25 where I said earlier: “Where one fattens well”, 26 and where I said: “His like was never born”; 27 and here it is necessary to make a fine distinction.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Tvam vicikitsase, ca icchasi yathā viśadyate 23 ittham spaṣṭayā ca vistīrṇayā vācā 24 mama vacanam, yat tava jñānāya anuvartamānaṃ syāt,
25 yatra pūrvam ahaṃ vadāmi: “Yatra suvarṇam vardhate”, 26 ca tatra yatra ahaṃ vadāmi: “Na jātaḥ dvitīyaḥ”; 27 ca atra āvaśyakam yathā suṣṭhu vivecyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 La provedenza, che governa il mondo 29 con quel consiglio nel quale ogne aspetto 30 creato è vinto pria che vada al fondo,
31 però che andasse ver’ lo suo diletto 32 la sposa di colui ch’ad alte grida 33 disposò lei col sangue benedetto,
34 in sé sicura e anche a lui più fida, 35 due principi ordinò in suo favore, 36 che quinci e quindi le fosser per guida.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Providence, which governs the world 29 with that counsel in which every created 30 thing is overcome before it comes to an end,
31 so that the bride of him who with loud cries 32 betrothed her with his blessed blood 33 might go to her beloved,
34 secure in herself and even more faithful to him, 35 ordained two princes in her favor, 36 who on this side and that were to be her guides.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Pradhānaśaktiḥ, yā jagatīṃ niyamati 29 tena mantreṇa yasmin viśvam jagat 30 sṛṣṭaṃ vijitya bhavati pūrvameva antaṃ prāpnoti,
31 yathā saḥ puruṣaḥ yasya mahābhir vāgbhiḥ 32 vivāho 'syaḥ kṛtaḥ āsīt puṇyena raktena, 33 tasya priyasya prati pratipadyate,
34 ātmani niścitā tathaiva tasmin adhikaśraddhā, 35 ubhayataḥ tayāḥ hitāya dve adhipatī adhiṣṭhāpayām āsa, 36 ye ubhayataḥ tayāḥ mārga-darśakatvena bhaveyuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 L’un fu tutto serafico in ardore; 38 l’altro per sapïenza in terra fue 39 di cherubica luce uno splendore.
query.result:
**English:**
37 One was all seraphic in ardor; 38 the other was on earth for wisdom 39 a splendor of cherubic light.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Ekaḥ sarvaḥ serāphikaḥ āsīt tejasi; 38 Aparo jñānena pṛthivyām āsīt 39 Ekaḥ cherubika-prakāśasya tejasaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 De l’un dirò, però che d’amendue 41 si dice l’un pregiando, qual ch’om prende, 42 perch’ ad un fine fur l’opere sue.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Of one I will speak, but of both 41 it is said, praising the one, whichever one takes, 42 because their works were for one end.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Ekasyāhaṃ vakṣyāmi, ubhayoḥ tu 41 Ekasya stutiṃ kurvan yaṃ yaṃ gṛhṇāti, 42 Yataḥ eka eva siddhāntaḥ karmaṇām āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Intra Tupino e l’acqua che discende 44 del colle eletto dal beato Ubaldo, 45 fertile costa d’alto monte pende,
46 onde Perugia sente freddo e caldo 47 da Porta Sole; e di rietro le piange 48 per grave giogo Nocera con Gualdo.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Between Tupino and the stream that descends 44 from the hill chosen by the blessed Ubaldo, 45 a fertile slope of a high mountain hangs,
46 from where Perugia feels the cold and heat 47 from Porta Sole; and behind it weeps 48 under a heavy yoke Nocera with Gualdo.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Tupino-nadyāḥ pravahatyāśca madhye 44 Ubaldo-muninā varitasya śaila-śreṣṭhasya, 45 unnata-parvatasya subhikṣaḥ paścādbhāgaḥ prapañcataḥ,
46 yataḥ Perugia-puraḥ śītam uṣṇam ca anubhavati 47 Porta Sole-dvāreṇa; tasya pṛṣṭhe 48 durga-yogena Nocera-Gualdo-purau rudatām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Di questa costa, là dov’ ella frange 50 più sua rattezza, nacque al mondo un sole, 51 come fa questo talvolta di Gange.
query.result:
**English:**
49 On this coast, where it breaks 50 its steepness most, a sun was born into the world, 51 as this one sometimes does from the Ganges.
**Sanskrit:**
49 Asyāṃ diśi, tatra yatra saḥ bhinatti 50 adhikaṃ svakāṭinyam, jātaḥ āsīt loke sūryaḥ, 51 yathā ayam kadācit Gangāyāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Però chi d’esso loco fa parole, 53 non dica Ascesi, ché direbbe corto, 54 ma Orïente, se proprio dir vuole.
query.result:
**English:**
52 But whoever speaks of that place, 53 let him not call it Ascent, for he would speak short, 54 but Orient, if he wants to speak precisely.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Yastu tasmāt sthānāt kathām karoti, 53 Na vaktavyam Ascesi, katham tu hrasvam vakṣyati, 54 Api tu Orïente, yadi svayam eva vaktuṃ icchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Ma perch’ io non proceda troppo chiuso, 74 Francesco e Povertà per questi amanti 75 prendi oramai nel mio parlar diffuso.
query.result:
**English:**
73 But so that I may not proceed too obscurely, 74 take now in my extended speech Francis and Poverty as these lovers.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Api tu mama na gūḍhamatiśayena pravartate, 74 Franciscus ca Daridryam ca ubhau premāturān, 75 Adyāpi gṛhāṇa mama vistīrṇavacane.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Oh ignota ricchezza! oh ben ferace! 83 Scalzasi Egidio, scalzasi Silvestro 84 dietro a lo sposo, sì la sposa piace.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Oh unknown riches! Oh fertile good! 83 Egidius goes barefoot, Sylvester goes barefoot 84 behind the Bridegroom, so pleasing is the Bride.
**Sanskrit:**
82 Aha ajñātaṃ dhanaṃ! Aha śubhaṃ phalaṃ! 83 Nagnaḥ padbhyāṃ gacchati Egidius, nagnaḥ padbhyāṃ gacchati Silveśvaraḥ 84 Patye anugacchatāḥ, tathā patnī priyā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Indi sen va quel padre e quel maestro 86 con la sua donna e con quella famiglia 87 che già legava l’umile capestro.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Then goes that father and that master 86 with his lady and with that family 87 that already bound the humble cord.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Tataḥ gacchati sa pita sa ca guruḥ 86 Sa-strī saha tena kulakena ca 87 Yat purvam eva babandha nīcaṃ śikṣā-sūtram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Poi che la gente poverella crebbe 95 dietro a costui, la cui mirabil vita 96 meglio in gloria del ciel si canterebbe,
97 di seconda corona redimita 98 fu per Onorio da l’Etterno Spiro 99 la santa voglia d’esto archimandrita.
query.result:
**English:**
94 After that the poor people increased 95 following this man, whose marvelous life 96 would be better sung in the glory of heaven,
97 crowned with a second crown 98 was the holy desire of this archimandrite 99 by Honorius from the Eternal Spirit.
**Sanskrit:**
94 Tataḥ paścāt janatā daridrā vavṛdhe 95 asya paścāt, yasya adbhutaṃ jīvitam 96 svargasya yaśasi śreyaḥ gāyeta,
97 dvitīyena mukuṭena śobhitā 98 āsīt Honoriyāt nityātmanā 99 asmāt ācāryāt puṇyā kāmaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 E poi che, per la sete del martiro, 101 ne la presenza del Soldan superba 102 predicò Cristo e li altri che ’l seguiro,
103 e per trovare a conversione acerba 104 troppo la gente e per non stare indarno, 105 redissi al frutto de l’italica erba,
106 nel crudo sasso intra Tevero e Arno 107 da Cristo prese l’ultimo sigillo, 108 che le sue membra due anni portarno.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And then, because of his thirst for martyrdom, 101 in the presence of the proud Sultan 102 he preached Christ and the others who followed him,
103 and because he found the people too obstinate to convert and so as not to stay there in vain, 104 he returned to the fruit of the Italian land,
105 in the harsh rock between the Tiber and the Arno 106 he received from Christ the final seal, 108 which his body bore for two years.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Tataś ca, martyriatṛṣṇayā, 101 Soldānasya garvamukhe, 102 Khristam pracacāra sa, anye ca ye tasya anuvartiṇaḥ,
103 Tataś ca, janaṃ durvṛttam dṛṣṭvā, niṣphalaśravaṇāt, 104 Punar āgacchat sa Itāliyāyāḥ kṣetraphalāya,
105 Tīvre śaile, Yamunā-Sarayor madhye, 106 Khristāt paramam lakṣaṇam prāpa, 108 Yac ca lakṣaṇam dve varṣe tasya śarīre sthitam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Quando a colui ch’a tanto ben sortillo 110 piacque di trarlo suso a la mercede 111 ch’el meritò nel suo farsi pusillo,
112 a’ frati suoi, sì com’ a giuste rede, 113 raccomandò la donna sua più cara, 114 e comandò che l’amassero a fede;
115 e del suo grembo l’anima preclara 116 mover si volle, tornando al suo regno, 117 e al suo corpo non volle altra bara.
query.result:
**English:**
109 When it pleased Him who had chosen him for so much good 110 to draw him up to the mercy 111 that he merited by making himself little,
112 to his friars, as to rightful heirs, 113 he commended his most dear lady, 114 and commanded that they should love her faithfully;
115 and from his lap the glorious soul 116 wished to depart, returning to its realm, 117 and for its body it desired no other bier.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Yada tasmai yaḥ svayamvaraṃ dadau 110 tam uccaiḥ kṛpāṃ prati nayitum ārabhata 111 yaṃ svayam kṛtvā kṣudraṃ sa arhati sma,
112 svakīyebhyaḥ śiṣyebhyaḥ, yathā nyāyyottaradhāriṇe, 113 svakīyāṃ priyatamāṃ strīṃ samarpitavān, 114 ca ādiṣṭavān yadi tām premṇā rakṣeyuḥ;
115 ca tasya āṅkāt tat tejasvī jīvaḥ 116 svakīyaṃ sthānam prati pratyāvartate sma icchati sma, 117 ca tasya śarīrasya anyāṃ śayyāṃ na icchati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Ben son di quelle che temono ’l danno 131 e stringonsi al pastor; ma son sì poche, 132 che le cappe fornisce poco panno.
query.result:
**English:**
130 I am indeed one of those who fear harm 131 and huddle close to the shepherd; but we are so few, 132 that the hoods provide little cloth.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Aham khalu tāsu anekāsu aham asmi yāḥ kṣitim bibhyati 131 paśupālaṃ ca āśritya vartante; kim tu tāḥ alpāḥ santi, 132 yataḥ kapālikānāṃ vastrāṇi alpam eva paṭṭaṃ prayacchanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Or, se le mie parole non son fioche, 134 se la tua audïenza è stata attenta, 135 se ciò ch’è detto a la mente revoche,
136 in parte fia la tua voglia contenta, 137 perché vedrai la pianta onde si scheggia, 138 e vedra’ il corrègger che argomenta
139 “U’ ben s’impingua, se non si vaneggia”».
query.result:
**English:**
133 Now, if my words are not hollow, 134 if your hearing has been attentive, 135 if what has been said recalls to your mind,
136 your desire will be partly satisfied, 137 because you will see the plant from which the splinter comes, 138 and you will see the correction that argues
139 “Where one grows fat, if one does not go astray”».
**Sanskrit:**
133 Atha yadi mama vacāṃsa na śuṣkāḥ santi, 134 yadi tava śravaṇam ākarṇayuktam āsīt, 135 yadi yat uktam tat manasi samāharati,
136 tava icchā aṃśataḥ santuṣṭā bhaviṣyati, 137 yataḥ tvam tarum drakṣyasi yataḥ kaṣṭham chidyate, 138 tathā drakṣyasi parivartanam yat yuktim ācakṣate
139 “Yatra samprasiddhiḥ bhavati, yadi mūḍhatā na kriyate” iti.
